summary: The New Testament is a special book for Christians, divided into 27 parts. It tells the story of Jesus and early Christianity. These writings were originally in Greek and were composed by different people over time. The list of books was first written down by a bishop named Athanasius in 367 AD. Scholars believe the Gospels, which are about Jesus' life, were written 40 to 60 years after his death, but there are different ideas about when the other books were written.
title: New Testament
